paper_abstract: Resolving a noted open problem, we show that the UNDIRECTED FEEDBACK VERTEX SET problem, parameterized by the size of the solution set of vertices, is in the parameterized complexity class Poly(k), that is, polynomial-time pre-processing is sufficient to reduce an initial problem instance (G, k) to a decision-equivalent simplified instance (G', k') where k' <= k, and the number of vertices of G' is bounded by a polynomial function of k. Our main result shows an O(k(11)) kernelization bound.
paper_title: The undirected feedback vertex set problem has a poly(k) kernel
